name: unclarified
content:
unclarified adjective
(INFORMATION)
Add to word list
Add to word list
not explained clearly or with enough detail: Several basic questions remain unclarified. The resolution leaves a number of key issues unclarified.
More examplesFewer examplesThe date of the meeting was changed, for reasons still unclarified. The fate of the other prisoners was unclarified but they were presumed dead.The nature of the difference remained unclarified.

unclarified adjective
(BUTTER)
food & drink
  specialized Unclarified butter or fat has not been heated to remove water and unwanted substances. : In a hot climate, unclarified butter spoils quickly.
More examplesFewer examplesThe solids in unclarified butter may burn before the dish is finished.Clarified butter can be used at a higher cooking temperature and will not go rancid as quickly as unclarified butter.
